review_title: Unprofessional, Cliquey all the way up to management, Bully culture among staff
pros: Good PTO benefits, Quick hire process
cons:
Cliquey, Poor Communication, Terrible management style, Management doesn't communicate with employee directly - only speaks to other staff regarding conflicts regarding you as an employee before speaking to you first, No nursing union, they don't like newbies to the company, Bully culture. 

I had a terrible experience at CMH. Now that I am working at a different hospital in Ventura County I have spoke to other RNs who have had similar experiences as I...even in other departments. These issues are hospital-wide...not just departmental. Staff members are extremely cliquey, and if they decide they don't like you they unite and lie/bend the truth about you to management. When management finally approached me about a conflict, they had a pre-typed written form and forced me to sign it rather than approaching me directly as soon as they heard about the conflict. Things within the written up form were a lie from staff, but they don't believe new employees...only the people who have been there for a while. I only worked here for 3 months. That was enough for me. *I have never in my life have had issues with management...NEVER. Even to this day. Stay away.

pros:

cons:

- Understaffed.

review_title: Worked in Pulmonary and poor management with cliques among MAs that pretty much come and go as they please
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Spokane, WA
pros: I was hired right out of college. It's great for experience but that's it. I was here for 2 years and worked with a top Pulmonologist who taught me more in 3 months that 2 years. Just ignore all the gossip and do your job and you're good.
cons: Constantly stressful due to favoritism in management. No cross-training which is helpful if someone is out sick. Not enough training (1 day) and your on your own. Board of Directors even was called in due to losing 2 providers and 2 employees who quit due to Rockwood and lack of communication.

review_title: One of the worst companies I have ever worked for
pros: I can't think of any.
cons: They claim to have one of the best benefits in the industry. That is not true. You start off by accruing 3 weeks vacation, but what they don't tell you is that part of that PTO is deducted for holiday pay. You actually get less than 2 weeks vacation. There are no merit increases in a year. They run their organization very lean and if you don't like it, they tell you go and find another job. Be careful. If you are offered a position in the corporate office, be sure to ask for hourly pay. Everyone else is on the department was an hourly employee, except for the new people they bring in. Very micro-managed environment. I have seen management belittle an experienced employees. Others employees can't wait to leave.

job_title: Nurse Tech in Oak Brook, IL
pros: Close to home. Benefits. Simone's was added.
cons: Lots of clicks. I've witnessed racism daily. "Engineers" harass the women as do the transporters. Most of their shifts are spent trying to hook up with women. Security liked to socialize more than protect. There were a few that were always high. Employees would go to their cars and get high during their shift. Too much micromanaging. Top heavy management. Not enough coverage for patients to effectively care for each one. Low raises. Atmosphere is very much like high school. Very immature. Lots of deviants.  New building still has issues from the shoddy construction. Plumbing was a huge problem.

job_title: RN II L&D (Med Surg/Tele Prior) in Somerset, NJ
pros: Your coworkers are awesome. Great team work in all departments. most patients are respectful and thankful. Most doctors are easy to work with and professional and give good care. Gated parking on site, although under construction. The hospital tries to give yearly or bi-yearly bonuses when the revenue has been good and stable. Wages have been on the rise in the last couple hears with the building of the new hospital. The new hospital is to be pristine and amazing!!!! Coming at the end of 2016. Lots of changes into full computer charting and orders (a bit behind in the times).
cons:
Some departments need help with management, i.e. There is A lot of micromanaging in Med-Surg/Tele departments. 
In Med/Surg getting an adequate break is a problem when busy and sometimes management would refuse to pay your missed lunch break pay. I once filled out a slip for my missed break and the following day the manager took the slip to my charge nurse and ripped it up in front of her stating, "we don't use these here." She claimed that since some days you get a long break when it's slow it makes up for the busy days when you don't get a break so it cancels each other out and she refuses to pay for missed breaks.
One, that's completely illegal. Two, it was never slow in that department. Let's just say she quietly "resigned" after a multitude of incidents like this with all the employees.
Other departments, such as Tele, ICU, L&D are great and you're paid every time your break is missed. Unfortunately we break ourselves and have no buddy system or break nurse due to hospital wide budgeting and policies so breaks are more often missed than received. 
The hospital is extremely busy in every single department and staffing has been a huge issue. We are, majority of the time, over extending our nurse patient ratio in all departments.
While building the new hospital, all budgeting has been strict so it's common for equipment to not get fixed appropriately or in a timely manner.
Also, they have been attempting to increase all our wages but even with the increases we still come in way under the bar, hence the lack of available staff. Majority of our staff is now new RNs. Also, they pay trainees significantly lower while training, I'm not sure how that is legal when one is liscensed, new or not, a state liscense is a state liscense. 
Lots and lots and lots of redundant charting In ALL departments. Not all systems talk to each other, there are At least three different charting systems in this hospital alone.

pros: Nice medium size employer in the area. Very much a famliy feel to the the organizaion. Many long serving employees 30+ years is a testament to "mom and pop" feel. Like most orgainzations, the best assets are the unsung workers on the front lines.
cons:
Some of the same "pros" contribute to the "cons". Sometimes there is resistance to change due to "old school" thought. There can be many efficiencies gained through exploration of new technologies, but take the time to properly explore them

There also seems to be a disconnect communcation between the upper management and front line.

cons: Not being given the ability to provide off-site training for my staff. Because of the services my group provided (IT), it would have been nice to be able to have training to improve the skillset of the staff.
